title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 January 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:02 <tekzilla> has quit  
00:07 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
00:21 <tekzilla> has quit  
00:32 <Enygma`> has quit  
00:35 <abusenius> has quit  
00:45 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
00:47 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki

01:16 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
01:50 <rrodriguez> has quit  
03:31 <rickross> has joined #xwiki  
03:31 <rickross> has left #xwiki  
03:32 <rickross> has joined #xwiki  
03:41 <rickross> has left #xwiki  
04:40 <sburjan`> has quit  
06:00 <Denis> has quit  
06:00 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:58 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:13 <sdumitriu> has quit  
08:48 <vmassol> there are still lots of links to add but it's a pain to add so I'll just publish the blog post now  
08:58 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
09:17 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <vmassol> has quit  
09:48 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <xredirectProblem> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <xredirectProblem> Hi guys, the "username" or "password" link of the login template have an incorrect "xredirect" param, missing the website domain. Could you help me find out why? (I have xwiki 3.3 installed here intranet.inf.usi.ch with an auto generated certificate)  
10:13 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <+mflorea> vmassol: can you help me with Wikimatrix and Wikipedia, i.e. upadate them regarding 3.4 RC1  
10:15 <+mflorea> the rest is done  
10:17 <vmassol> mflorea: yep just need 30 mn to finish someting first  
10:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <vmassol> doing wikimarix  
10:26 <vmassol> I've checked the "markdown support" :)  
10:26 <vmassol> mflorea: any new languages that we have and that are not listed there?  
10:27 <+mflorea> nop, we just updated lv  
10:27 <vmassol> done  
10:30 <vmassol> done for wikipedia too  
10:40 <+mflorea> thanks  
11:15 <xredirectProblem> Hi guys, the "username" or "password" link of the login template have an incorrect "xredirect" param, missing the website domain. Could you help me find out why? (I have xwiki 3.3 installed here intranet.inf.usi.ch with an auto generated certificate)  
11:24 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <sburjan> has quit  
11:27 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:34 <+evalica> mflorea: the link in the mail is for M1 instead of RC1  
11:37 <vmassol> mflorea: can we commit on master now? Is master set to be 4.0M1?  
11:37 <+mflorea> 3.5-SNAPSHOT  
11:38 <vmassol> ok we need to decide  
11:38 <vmassol> if we want to do 3.5 on  a branch or not  
11:38 <vmassol> (ie be able to start dev for 4.0 or not)  
11:38 <vmassol> there are pros and cons  
11:38 <vmassol> probably more cons  
11:38 <vmassol> :)  
11:39 <vmassol> so forget this  
11:39 <vmassol> ;)  
11:39 <+mflorea> ok :)  
11:39 <vmassol> the only risk is that devs might be tempted to push stuff for 3.5 that should not go there becasue they're new stuff or risky  
11:40 <+mflorea> we could create a branch for 4.0-SNAPSHOT and make that master after we release 3.5  
11:41 <vmassol> the safe side is the other way around  
11:41 <vmassol> if we want to allow devs to work for 4.0  
11:41 <vmassol> hten we should make master be 4.0  
11:41 <vmassol> but I'm not so keen on this  
11:42 <vmassol> since it's best if we all stick together and work on stabilizing 3.x  
11:48 <+sburjan> +1  
12:11 <+mflorea> evalica: thanks  
12:11 <rrodriguez> has quit  
12:12 <+sburjan> I am on 3.4 RC1, and if I want to install Jira Macro from EM, I get no restults. I get the result if I search for JIRA, but nothing for JIRA macro  
12:12 <+sburjan> it seems also EM is casesensitive  
12:12 <+sburjan> IMO it shouldn't be  
12:25 <mflorea> has quit  
12:35 <+tmortagne> sburjan: could you create an issue for case sensitivity ?  
12:35 <+tmortagne> (it's not EM but XR actually)  
12:36 <+sburjan> tmortagne: okay  
13:08 <evalica> has left #xwiki  
13:08 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <vmassol> maven 3.0.4 being released… should be avail in a few days now  
13:46 <evalica> has quit  
13:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:53 <+tmortagne> vmassol: cool  
13:58 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <sburjan> has quit  
14:12 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <xredirectProblem> bummer!  
14:40 <xredirectProblem> Hi guys, the "username" or "password" link of the login template have an incorrect "xredirect" param, missing the website domain. Could you help me find out why? (I have xwiki 3.3 installed here intranet.inf.usi.ch with an auto generated certificate)  
15:18 <vmassol> do I need to create 2 JIRA issues for moving something from XE to platform or is one enough?  
15:18 <vmassol> (I'm always hesitating….)  
15:24 <vmassol> and if only should it be in the source jira project or the target one?  
15:24 <vmassol> s/if only/if only one/  
15:52 <+tmortagne> vmassol: since you do modification in two project I think it shoud be two jira issues  
15:52 <vmassol> ideally yes  
15:53 <vmassol>  I was wondering if we wanted to make that a hard rule or not, since it creates extra jiras  
15:53 <vmassol> personally I know that I haven't always done it  
15:53 <vmassol> because it's a pain most of the time  
15:53 <vmassol> basically it's mostly useful when you don't aggregate release notes  
17:01 <+jvdrean> Hi, did something change about the way xwiki-commons-tool-xar-plugin works between 3.1 and 3.3 ?  
17:01 <+jvdrean> I used to rely on the fact that it was expanding dependencies in target/classes/ but after the upgrade it stopped to do so  
17:08 <vmassol> yes tmortagne changed it  
17:08 <vmassol> but I don't think thomas changed the default config  
17:08 <vmassol> he just added the ability to not bundle XAR deps I think  
17:09 <vmassol> tmortagne: ?  
17:09 <+tmortagne> jvdrean: yes it does not bundle the dependencies by default now to be more maven oriented  
17:09 <+tmortagne> you have to ask for it  
17:09 <+tmortagne> look at ui-all pom.cml  
17:09 <+tmortagne> xml  
17:10 <+tmortagne> <includeDependencies>true</includeDependencies>  
17:10 <+tmortagne> in plugin configuration  
17:10 <+jvdrean> I was looking for it, without luck TBH :)  
17:10 <+jvdrean> where is it ?  
17:11 <+tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-distribution/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/pom.xml  
17:11 <+jvdrean> ah it's in distribution  
17:11 <+tmortagne> yep  
17:12 <+tmortagne> as a "just distributed and not really supposed to be used as dependency of another maven project"  
17:12 <+tmortagne> so it more of less follow jar behavior now basically  
17:12 <+sburjan> tmortagne: regarding the case sensitivity issue, should I report it to Platform project ? I have issues finding the XR - Extension Repository module  
17:12 <+tmortagne> except that you don't have built in jar merge feature in jar plugin ;)  
17:13 <+tmortagne> sburjan: yes eveything is in platform, XR is part of the general jira component extension manager  
17:13 <+sburjan> ok, so putting Extension Manager module  
17:24 <+sburjan> funny, now I am unable to reproduce on RC1`  
17:25 <+tmortagne> sburjan: it has nothing to do with EM so there is no way using a different version of XE change anything  
17:26 <+sburjan> did something changed to XR in the last hours ?  
17:26 <+tmortagne> and from what I can see in the case there is nothing to make sure the case is ignored so except in a MySQL which is ignoring the case the behavior that made you create the issue is "expected"  
17:26 <+sburjan> something that is already used in production  
17:26 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I did not touched xwiki.org since a while  
17:27 <+tmortagne> s/in the case/in the code/  
17:47 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:52 <xredirectProblem> has quit  
17:53 <Denis> has quit  
18:22 <vmassol> mflorea: fyi I'm getting this in the build (not sure if I've reported it already or not):  
18:22 <vmassol> [INFO] Running XWiki GWT-DOM Unit Tests  
18:22 <vmassol> [INFO] [WARN] Unable to create new cache log file /Users/vmassol/dev/xwiki/git/xwiki-platform/target/www-test/../gwt-unitCache/gwt-unitCache-00000134FC244437.  
18:22 <vmassol> [INFO] java.io.IOException: No such file or directory  
18:22 <vmassol> [INFO] at java.io.UnixFileSystem.createFileExclusively(Native Method)  
18:22 <vmassol> [INFO] at java.io.File.createNewFile(File.java:883)  
18:22 <vmassol> [INFO] at com.google.gwt.dev.javac.PersistentUnitCache.<init>(PersistentUnitCache.java:331)  
18:23 <+mflorea> you told me about this before, and I was aware of it. GWT logs this from time to time, but it's harmless. I search a bit and it seems it's a GWT issue  
18:24 <+mflorea> I don't get it every time  
18:25 <vmassol> I'll create a jira issue for us later on since we need to fix this. In the issue can link to an issue on the GWT issue tracker (is there one?)  
18:26 <sburjan> has quit  
18:27 <vmassol> logged here so that we remember it: [INFO] -------------------------------------------------------  
18:27 <vmassol> [INFO]  T E S T S  
18:27 <vmassol> [INFO] -------------------------------------------------------  
18:27 <vmassol> [INFO] Running XWiki GWT-DOM Unit Tests  
18:27 <vmassol> [INFO] [WARN] Unable to create new cache log file /Users/vmassol/dev/xwiki/git/xwiki-platform/target/www-test/../gwt-unitCache/gwt-unitCache-00000134FC244437.  
18:27 <vmassol> has quit  
18:28 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:28 <vmassol> bad copy paste  
18:28 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-7422  
18:28 <vmassol> if you have more info about it you can put them in the jira issue  
19:15 <evalica> has left #xwiki  
19:15 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
19:17 <mflorea> has quit  
19:20 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
19:24 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
20:14 <vmassol> hmm I think marius forgot to update some pom.xml with the new version on master  
20:15 <vmassol> yep  
20:16 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I have several commits done locally already. If I make a new change, is it easy to commit and push only that change and not the others I've done?  
20:16 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: It's not extremely easy, but it's quickly doable  
20:17 <@sdumitriu> Did you already make the new change?  
20:17 <vmassol> ok… then the other option is that someone else just replace 3.4-SNAPSHOT with 3.5-SNASPHOT on mater  
20:17 <vmassol> nope  
20:17 <vmassol> not yet  
20:17 <vmassol> \*master  
20:17 <vmassol> can you do it?  
20:17 <@sdumitriu> Sure  
20:17 <vmassol> thanks  
20:17 <@sdumitriu> It should have been changed already  
20:17 <@sdumitriu> Which pom?  
20:17 <vmassol> you can do a grep  
20:17 <@sdumitriu> OK,  
20:17 <vmassol> there are quite a few  
20:17 <vmassol> commons  
20:17 <vmassol> enterprise  
20:19 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r37b9012 / pom.xml : [misc] Fixed versions after branch - http://git.io/jlNstA  
20:19 <vmassol> rendering  
20:19 <@sdumitriu> Strange, this should have been done by the release script...  
20:23 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rb5d872a / pom.xml : [misc] Fixed versions after branch - http://git.io/EbVHvg  
20:24 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I think the top level version for rendering should bekept  
20:35 <vmassol> enterprise too is missing version update I think`  
20:45 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rd87c47e / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/DownloadAction.java : XWIKI-7423: Attachments cannot be downloaded when using WebLogic as the servlet container ...  
20:45 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Doing the rest now, I had a commit to finish on platform first  
20:45 <vmassol> ok  
20:46 <@sdumitriu> Why would you keep the explicit version in the pom?  
20:46 <vmassol> I think top level pom for each project should define its version no?  
20:46 <vmassol> they need to control their version IMO  
20:46 <vmassol> it's just luck that they have the same version  
20:46 <vmassol> "luck"  
20:47 <@sdumitriu> Well, we make our own luck :)  
20:47 <@sdumitriu> IMO we could add the explicit version when needed  
20:48 <vmassol> I don't like it too much, maybe this should be discussed  
20:48 <vmassol> I'm not sure why it bothers me  
20:48 <vmassol> maybe I remember some issues I had in the past on other projects  
20:49 <vmassol> can't figure exactly why though  
20:52 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rb0ba3ca / (8 files in 8 dirs): [misc] Fixed versions after branch - http://git.io/o5TAEA  
21:10 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r2b49f76 / pom.xml : [misc] Fixed versions after branch - http://git.io/aBRZ9Q  
21:45 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu stable-3.4.x \* r88c249a / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/DownloadAction.java : XWIKI-7423: Attachments cannot be downloaded when using WebLogic as the servlet container ...  
22:01 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: there is a mail on the users list about annotationsand MySQL .. is that a real problem or just a bad usecase ?  
22:01 <@sdumitriu> Checking  
22:02 <@sdumitriu> It's a bug  
22:03 <+sburjan`> should I tell the user to report it on JIRA ?  
22:05 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
22:07 <+sburjan`> done  
22:08 <vmassol> sdumitriu: enterprise is still on 3.4-SNAP  
22:08 <vmassol> (on master)  
22:08 <@sdumitriu> Really?  
22:08 <vmassol> (the parent pom)  
22:08 <@sdumitriu> Did I forgot to push?  
22:08 <@sdumitriu> Yep, forgot to push  
22:08 <CIA-121> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r2955c2f / pom.xml : [misc] Updated versions after branch - http://git.io/5J8NHg  
22:08 <@sdumitriu> Thanks  
22:08 <vmassol> thanks  
22:09 <+sburjan`> sdumitriu: so basically any comment or annotation can't exceed 255 chars ATM ? or it's just a hibernate - mySQL mapping issue  
22:10 <kkb110> has joined #xwiki  
22:10 <@sdumitriu> No, it's a bug in the code  
22:10 <@sdumitriu> We already trim comments for the xwikidoc table  
22:11 <@sdumitriu> We just have to do the same for mysql  
22:11 <@sdumitriu> We just have to do the same for xwikircs  
22:11 <+sburjan`> so all db's are affected  
22:11 <kkb110> Q: what other frameworks out there those are comparable to xwiki in terms of that it's rather more general framework than just wiki  
22:12 <@sdumitriu> Not all  
22:12 <@sdumitriu> hsqldb isn't  
22:20 <vmassol> hmm I must be doing something wrong, when I build enterprise I still get 3.4-SNAPSHOT jars  
22:25 <vmassol> mvn dependency:tree shows  
22:25 <vmassol> [INFO] org.xwiki.enterprise:xwiki-enterprise-web:war:3.5-SNAPSHOT  
22:25 <vmassol> [INFO] +- org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-web:war:3.4-SNAPSHOT:compile  
22:26 <vmassol> so platform.version must be wrong  
22:26 <vmassol> checking  
22:27 <vmassol> ok must be because I didn't rebuild commons locally  
22:28 <pgmjsd> has left #xwiki  
22:30 <vmassol> has quit  
22:33 <npm\_> is now known as <npm>
